summary: I wasn't happy with other mods, because they are to big or with alot of bugs.
descriptionHtml:
So, this is my first Mod, not actually a Overhaul, but I want to change a lot of things about smithing in Skyrim, also I didn't do much yet, only made this.
I want to make able to smelt all sets into their basic ingots, but less than the recipe. And sorry for any spelling error, english is my second language.
Any tips are welcome, and also if you use this and find a bug, tell me. 

0.3
- Fur armor complete, can take leather or leather strips using tanning rack.
- Hide Armor complete, can take leather or leather strips using tanning rack.
- Leather Armor complete, can take leather or leather strips using tanning rack.
- Draedic Armor complete, can take Ebony Ingots or Draedic Heart but need a Grand Soul Gem Filled, the ingots from
the smelter and the Draedic Heart from the Forge (because didn't know where to put it).
- Dragon Scale Armor complete, can take Dragon Scales using the Forge.
- Dragon Plate Armor complete, can take Dragon Bones using the Forge.
- Dwarven Armor complete, can take Dwarven Metal Ingot using the Smelter.
- Ebony Armor Complete, can take Ebony Ingot using Smelter.
- Iron Armor complete, can take Iron Ingot using Smelter.
- Elven Armor Complete, can take Moonstone Ingot using the Smelter, 
Quicksilver also can be taken from Gloves and Armor.
- Scaled Armor complete, can take Corundum using Smelter.
- Steel Armor and Steel Plate Armor complete, can take Iron Ingot using Smelter.
- Glass Armor complete, can take Malachite Ingot using the Smelter, 
Moonstone also can be taken but it needs two from each but the armor.
- Blades Armor complte, can take Steel Ingot using the smelter, but for balance purpose, 
it needs the Ebony Armor Perk because the chest is better than Ebony
and i'm planning to make this Armor Craftable in a optional file.
- Able to craft a Long Bow.

0.2
Fix the Imperial Light Shield smelting to Steel ingot from Tanning Rack and putting it on Smelter.

0.1
 - Able to Smelt Heavy Imperial Armor into Steel Ingots, and needs the Smelting Steel Perk.
 - Able to take Leather Strips from Heavy Imperial Armor using the Tanning Rack, don't need the Smelting Steel Perk.
 - Able to Smelt Light Imperial Armor into Steel Ingots, also needs the Smelting Steel Perk.
 - Able to take Leather Strips from Light Imperial Armor using Tanning Rack, don't need the Smelting Steel Perk.
 - Able to craft Dawnbreaker with the Dragon Armor Perk.
author: Lucandor
